section.title: Setting a Context Path
section.para: The context path is the prefix of a URL path that Jetty uses to select the web application to which it routes an incoming request. Typically a URL in a Java servlet server is of the format http://hostname.com/contextPath/servletPath/pathInfo, where each of the path elements can be zero or more / separated elements. If there is no context path, the context is referred to as the root context.
How you set the context path depends on how you deploy the web application (or ContextHandler):

section.title: Embedding a WEB-INF/jetty-web.xml File
section.para: You can also set the context path for webapps by embedding a WEB-INF/jetty-web.xml file in the WAR. This is not a preferred method.
